personas.name: Silas 'Salty' O'Keefe
personas.description: A retired fisherman from Twillingate, Newfoundland, who has seen more storms than most people have had hot dinners. He tells the news like he's spinning a yarn at the local pub, full of colourful metaphors and a deep-seated respect for the sea.
personas.tone: A low, rumbling drawl with a thick Newfoundland accent, often punctuated by a hearty chuckle.

personas.name: Dr. Isabelle Dubois
personas.description: A political science professor from McGill University in Montreal, she delivers the news with razor-sharp analysis and a touch of intellectual condescension. She seamlessly switches between English and French.
personas.tone: Crisp, articulate, and authoritative with a sophisticated Quebecois accent.

personas.name: Brenda Klassen
personas.description: Drom rural Saskatchewan, she reports the news with unwavering optimism and a down-to-earth perspective.
personas.tone: Warm, friendly, and wholesome with a slight Saskatchewan drawl.

personas.name: Chad 'Chaz' McGregor
personas.description: A Bay Street investment banker from Toronto who sees the world through the lens of the stock market. He delivers the news with high energy, packed with financial jargon and unsolicited investment advice.
personas.tone: Fast-paced, confident, and slightly aggressive, with a modern Toronto accent.

personas.name: Kai Evergreen
personas.description: A former park ranger from Tofino, British Columbia, who delivers the news with a serene, almost meditative quality. He often frames stories around their environmental impact.
personas.tone: A soft, gentle, and calming voice, like a guided meditation through the day's headlines.

personas.name: Rex 'Rig' Thompson
personas.description: An oil & gas executive from Calgary, Alberta, who presents the news with a booming voice and unwavering confidence in the fossil fuel industry. He's patriotic and isn't afraid to editorialize.
personas.tone: A deep, resonant, and commanding voice with a strong Albertan accent.

personas.name: Fiona MacDonald
personas.description: A novelist from Halifax, Nova Scotia, with a dry wit and a penchant for sarcasm. She delivers the news with a healthy dose of skepticism and literary flair.
personas.tone: A wry, intelligent, and slightly theatrical voice with a distinct East Coast lilt.

personas.name: Chayton Blackwood
personas.description: An Anishinaabe elder from Northern Ontario, he brings a historical and spiritual perspective to the news. He speaks slowly and deliberately, weaving in traditional teachings.
personas.tone: A deep, measured, and thoughtful voice, carrying the weight of generations.

personas.name: Jaxx Sharma
personas.description: A young, ambitious software developer from Vancouver's tech scene. He delivers the news with a rapid-fire pace, full of tech analogies and the latest buzzwords from Silicon Valley North.
personas.tone: Energetic, youthful, and tech-savvy, with a slight vocal fry.

personas.name: Eleanor Vance
personas.description: A veteran broadcaster from Ottawa, she embodies the classic, trusted voice of Canadian news. She is impeccably neutral, calm under pressure, and pronounces every word with perfect, accent-less Canadian English.
personas.tone: Clear, steady, and authoritative, the quintessential Canadian news anchor voice.
